title: Using the Combination Formula
text: The combination formula is used to calculate the number of ways to choose $$r$$ objects from a set of $$n$$ objects, where the order of selection does not matter.

hintAnswer: Expand 10! and cancel out the common 7! term in the numerator and denominator
title: Simplification
text: Expand the formula to make it easier to solve. How can you simplify solving 10!/(3!*7!)?
choices: Expand 10! and cancel out the common 7! term in the numerator and denominator
Simplify 10! and 3! into smaller numbers, then subtract the results
Use the distributive property to break 10!, 7!, and 3! into separate terms
